key_risks: Intense market competition from larger national carriers
High costs and logistical challenges in maintaining rural coverage
Regulatory changes impacting operations and profitability
Customer retention challenges and reputational damage
Legal scrutiny and potential financial liabilities from class-action lawsuits
controversies: Class-action lawsuit alleging false statements about customer retention promotions
Proposed class-action securities lawsuit for misleading investors
Increased short interest indicating bearish investor sentiment
social_issues: Privacy and data security concerns in telecommunications
governance_issues: Legal and financial scrutiny over alleged misleading statements
Strategic uncertainty due to transfer of operations to T-Mobile

sources.title: T-Mobile and UScellular, GN Docket No. 24-286 | Federal Communications ...
sources.snippet: T-Mobile US, Inc. (T-Mobile) and United States Cellular Corporation (UScellular) have announced an agreement for the transfer to T-Mobile of UScellular's wireless operations, customers, and certain spectrum licenses and spectrum leases. According to the parties, UScellular is retaining approximately 70% of its spectrum holdings and all of its approximately 4,400 towers.
